description: Donald Trump is pursuing a breakaway strategy characterized by the implementation of dramatic tariffs, an intensification of immigration controls and the continuation of tax policies favoring the wealthiest Americans.

Thailand and Cambodia dispute whether ceasefire is holding
description: After five days of clashes which killed at least 36 people and displaced tens of thousands more, Thailand and Cambodia's leaders had met in Malaysia and had agreed to a truce 'from 24 hours local time, midnight' on July 28, 2025.

headline: Five dead, including gunman, after NYC shooting in Midtown Manhattan
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said they are still 'unraveling' what took place. 'Five innocent people were shot' along with the perpetrator, he said after the shooting on Midtown's Park Avenue. Officials later confirmed that the 'lone shooter,' who died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound, killed four, including a police officer, and wounded another.

headline: Three erotic experiences inspired by artistic performances
description: Maïa Mazaurette is on a mission to spice up your steamy summer nights. This week, she offers suggestions to awaken your creativity and transform your intimate space into the stage for a very unique happening.

headline: Initial tariff impacts painful for auto, textile and chemical industries
description: Six months after Donald Trump introduced the first US tariffs, companies have started to feel the effects of a shock whose repercussions, though they have been contained for now, are likely to be long-lasting.
byline: Bastien Bonnefous,  Eric Albert and  Juliette Garnier

Is there a genocide in Gaza? Why legal experts are split
description: Genocide, as defined by the 1948 convention, requires both certain criminal acts to be committed and genocidal intent. While the requisite acts have been proven in Gaza, legal scholars are divided over the intent. South Africa has filed a genocide complaint against Israel with the International Court of Justice in The Hague.

headline: Tadej Pogacar, a Tour de France champion weary of his own dominance
description: The 26-year-old Slovenian cyclist claimed victory in the race on Sunday for the fourth time in his career. He finished over four minutes ahead of his rival Jonas Vingegaard in the overall standings, with the Dane unable to threaten his lead.

headline: France's Gergovie plateau continues to reveal its ancient secrets
description: After four years exploring the depths of this archeological site in central France, archeologists have begun to draw their first conclusions, particularly regarding the so-called 'craftsmen's quarter.' This is the fourth excavation campaign at Gergovie since 1861, a site that once hosted the capital of the Arverni people.
